Package game.interfaces

Interface Soul

All Known Implementing Classes:
Aldrich, Mimic, Player, Skeleton, SoulToken, Undead, Yhorm
public interface Soul
A contract for soul-able instance (in other words, object/instance that has souls). The instance can be Actor, Item, or even Ground.
See Also:
DesignOSoulsAddOn

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    default boolean addSouls​(int souls)
    Increase souls to current instance's souls.
    default boolean subtractSouls​(int souls)
    Allow other classes to deduct the number of this instance's souls By default, an instance cannot get its own souls subtracted.
    void transferSouls​(Soul soulObject)
    Transfer current instance's souls to another Soul instance.

  • Method Details

    • transferSouls

      void transferSouls​(Soul soulObject)
      Transfer current instance's souls to another Soul instance.
      Parameters:
      soulObject - a target souls.

    • addSouls

      default boolean addSouls​(int souls)
      Increase souls to current instance's souls. By default, it cannot increase the souls. You may override this method to implement its functionality.
      Parameters:
      souls - number of souls to be incremented.
      Returns:
      transaction status. True if addition successful, otherwise False.

    • subtractSouls

      default boolean subtractSouls​(int souls)
      Allow other classes to deduct the number of this instance's souls By default, an instance cannot get its own souls subtracted. You may override this method to conduct subtraction on current souls.
      Parameters:
      souls - number souls to be deducted
      Returns:
      transaction status. True if subtraction successful, otherwise False.
